judges: Before Frazer, C. J,, Simpson, Kephart, Schaefer, Maxey and Drew, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The six judges who heard this appeal were equally divided in opinion. The decree of the Orphans’ Court of Philadelphia County is accordingly affirmed; costs to be paid by appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Francis B. Bracken, with him Bevan A. Pennypacker, Walter M. Barkhardt and Ellwood J. Rotan, for appellants.
Joseph A. Alleni, with him William F. Brennan, for Emily L. Hellerman, one of appellees.
Henry L. 8chimpf, Jr., for Union Home for Old Ladies, a remainderman.
casebody.head_matter:
Kelch’s Estate.
Argued January 16, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J,, Simpson, Kephart, Schaefer, Maxey and Drew, JJ.
Francis B. Bracken, with him Bevan A. Pennypacker, Walter M. Barkhardt and Ellwood J. Rotan, for appellants.
Joseph A. Alleni, with him William F. Brennan, for Emily L. Hellerman, one of appellees.
Henry L. 8chimpf, Jr., for Union Home for Old Ladies, a remainderman.
April 15, 1935:
